# Part B : ì»¨í…ì¸  ë¹Œë“œ
## Step 1 : ì½˜í…ì¸  íƒ€ì… ë¹Œë” ë„¤ë¹„ê²Œì´ì…˜ì—ì„œ ì½œë ‰ì…˜ íƒ€ì… ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
###  1. "Restrunat" ì½œë ‰ì…˜ íƒ€ì… ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
1.  Go to PluginsÂ ![Content-type Builder icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content_types_builder.b05294fe.svg)Â [Content-type BuilderÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/plugins/content-type-builder)in the main navigation.
2.  Click onÂ **Create new collection type**.
3.  TypeÂ `Restaurant`Â for theÂ _Display name_, and clickÂ **Continue**.
4.  Click the Text field.
5.  TypeÂ `name`Â in theÂ _Name_Â field.
6.  Switch to theÂ _Advanced Settings_Â tab, and check theÂ **Required field**Â and theÂ **Unique field**Â settings.
7.  Click onÂ **Add another field**.
8.  Choose the Rich text field.
9.  TypeÂ `description`Â under theÂ _Name_Â field, then clickÂ **Finish**.
10.  Finally, clickÂ **Save**Â and wait for Strapi to restart.

### 2. "Category" ì½œë ‰ì…˜ íƒ€ì… ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
1.  Go to PluginsÂ ![Content-type Builder icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content_types_builder.b05294fe.svg)Â [Content-type BuilderÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/plugins/content-type-builder)in the main navigation.
2.  Click onÂ **Create new collection type**.
3.  TypeÂ `Category`Â for theÂ _Display name_, and clickÂ **Continue**.
4.  Click the Text field.
5.  TypeÂ `name`Â in theÂ _Name_Â field.
6.  Switch to theÂ _Advanced Settings_Â tab, and check theÂ **Required field**Â and theÂ **Unique field**Â settings.
7.  Click onÂ **Add another field**.
8.  Choose the Relation field.
9.  On the right side, click theÂ _Category_Â relational fields box and select "Restaurant".
10.  In the center, select the icon that represents "many-to-many"Â ![icon many-to-many](data:image/png;base64,). The text should readÂ `Categories has and belongs to many Restaurants`.
11.  Finally, clickÂ **Finish**, then theÂ **Save**Â button, and wait for Strapi to restart.

### Step 2: ì½œë ‰ì…˜ íƒ€ì… ì ìš©í•˜ë©´ì„œ ìƒˆ ì—”íŠ¸ë¦¬ ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
### 1. "Restaurant" ì—”íŠ¸ë¦¬ ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
1.  Go toÂ ![Content Manager icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content.e57144d5.svg)Â [Content Manager > Collection types - RestaurantÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::restaurant.restaurant)in the navigation.
2.  Click onÂ **Add new entry**.
3.  Type the name of your favorite local restaurant in theÂ _Name_Â field. Let's say it'sÂ `Biscotte Restaurant`.
4.  In theÂ _Description_Â field, write a few words about it. If you're lacking some inspiration, you can useÂ `Welcome to Biscotte restaurant! Restaurant Biscotte offers a cuisine based on fresh, quality products, often local, organic when possible, and always produced by passionate producers.`
5.  ClickÂ **Save**.
	
	The restaurant is now listed in theÂ [Collection types - RestaurantÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::restaurant.restaurant)view.

### 2. ì¹´í…Œê³ ë¦¬ ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
Let's go toÂ ![Content Manager icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content.e57144d5.svg)Â [Content Manager > Collection types - CategoryÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::category.category)and create 2 categories:

1.  Click onÂ **Add new entry**.
2.  TypeÂ `French Food`Â in theÂ _Name_Â field.
3.  ClickÂ **Save**.
4.  Go back toÂ _Collection types - Category_, then click again onÂ **Add new entry**.
5.  TypeÂ `Brunch`Â in theÂ _Name_Â field, then clickÂ **Save**.
The "French Food" and "Brunch" categories are now listed in theÂ [Collection types - CategoryÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::category.category)view.

### 2.1 ë ˆìŠ¤í† ë‘ ì—”í‹°í‹°ì— ì¹´í…Œê³ ë¦¬ ì ìš©í•˜ê¸°
Go toÂ ![Content Manager icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content.e57144d5.svg)Â [Content Manager > Collection types - RestaurantÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::restaurant.restaurant)in the navigation, and click on "Biscotte Restaurant".

In the right sidebar, in theÂ **Categories**Â drop-down list, select "Brunch". ClickÂ **Save**.

## Step 3 : ì—­í• ê³¼ ê¶Œí•œ ì„¤ì •í•˜ê¸°

> [!NOTE] 
> We have just added a restaurant and 2 categories. We now have enough content to consume (pun intended). But first, we need to make sure that the content is publicly accessible through the API:
1.  Click onÂ _GeneralÂ ![Settings icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/settings.c9562686.svg)Â Settings_Â at the bottom of the main navigation.
2.  UnderÂ _Users & Permissions Plugin_, chooseÂ [RolesÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/settings/users-permissions/roles).
3.  Click theÂ **Public**Â role.
4.  Scroll down underÂ _Permissions_.
5.  In theÂ _Permissions_Â tab, findÂ _Restaurant_Â and click on it.
6.  Click the checkboxes next toÂ **find**Â andÂ **findone**. (CRUD ê¶Œí•œì„ ë¶€ì—¬í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ë¶€ë¶„)
7.  Repeat withÂ _Category_: click the checkboxes next toÂ **find**Â andÂ **findone**. (ì„¤ì •í•˜ë©´ì„œ API ë¼ìš°íŒ…ë„ ìë™ìœ¼ë¡œ ì™„ë£Œë¨.)
8.  Finally, clickÂ **Save**.

## Step 4 : ì»¨í…ì¸  ë°°í¬í•˜ê¸°
> [!NOTE] 
> By default, any content you create is saved as a draft. Let's publish our categories and restaurant.

First, navigate toÂ ![Content Manager icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content.e57144d5.svg)Â [Content Manager > Collection types - CategoryÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::category.category). From there:

1.  Click the "Brunch" entry.
2.  On the next screen, clickÂ **Publish**.
3.  In theÂ _Confirmation_Â window, clickÂ **Yes, publish**.

Then, go back to the Categories list and repeat for the "French Food" category.

Finally, to publish your favorite restaurant, go toÂ ![Content Manager icon](https://docs.strapi.io/assets/img/content.e57144d5.svg)Â [Content Manager > Collection types - RestaurantÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/admin/content-manager/collectionType/api::restaurant.restaurant), click the restaurant entry, andÂ **Publish**Â it.

## Step 5 : API ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê¸°
OK dear gourmet, we have just finished creating our content and making it accessible through the API. You can give yourself a pat on the back â€” but you have yet to see the final result of your hard work.

There you are: the list of restaurants is accessible atÂ [http://localhost:1337/api/restaurantsÂ (opens new window)](http://localhost:1337/api/restaurants).

Try it now! The result should be similar to the example response below ğŸ‘‡.
```json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "attributes": {
        "name": "Biscotte Restaurant",
        "description": "Welcome to Biscotte restaurant! Restaurant Biscotte offers a cuisine based on fresh, quality products, often local, organic when possible, and always produced by passionate producers.",
        "createdAt": "2021-11-18T13:34:53.885Z",
        "updatedAt": "2021-11-18T13:59:05.035Z",
        "publishedAt": "2021-11-18T13:59:05.033Z"
      }
    }
  ],
  "meta": {
    "pagination": {
      "page": 1,
      "pageSize": 25,
      "pageCount": 1,
      "total": 1
    }
  }
}
```

ğŸ¥³ CONGRATULATIONS!
> Now your content is created, published, and you have permissions to request it through the API. Keep on creating amazing content!
